results.title: Historical marine paintings by Richard Linton
results.brief_description: Richard Linton was born in Melbourne in 1935. He began working in photolithography after studying at the Australian School of Printing. His first serious painting of a sailing ship was in 1957. His love of history and meticulous attention to detail make him a world authority on the subject and unique in today’s art world. With his knowledge of printing he also produces limited edition prints of his works. In this video, Richard Linton explains his working process, including researching and painting, and talks about his paintings of Australian and overseas built sailing ships.

results.title: Histoire de poissons
results.brief_description: A third language training film relating adventures of the Martin family. The family is on holiday in France and M. Martin is out fishing - Monsieur le Cure is coming for dinner and, being Friday, fish is essential. The foibles of promising a fish dinner are developed, wherein each member of the family purchases a fish to make sure there will be plenty for the dinner guest.

results.title: Histoire D'adrien = Story of Adrien
results.brief_description:
Adrien, an illegitimate child, must endure the nastiness of those around him. Only his grandmother gives him love and understanding. After her death, the young boy finds a job as a flour-mill worker. Adrien witnesses the changes in country life as machines take on the jobs of several men. Adrien grows up and becomes a railway worker and falls in love with a laundress, Marguerite. But her parents to do not look favourably on their daughter marrying a poor man. In order to evoke the memory of country life in the South of France at the turn of the 20th Century, Jean-Pierre Denis delved into the collective memory of actors and locals who spoke exclusively in Occitan. This gave a great authenticity to the depiction (or painting, as certain scenes are filmed to resemble works by Georges de la Tour) of rural life and contributed to ascertain that an original, local culture had survived successive waves of modernisation and mechanisation. In parallel, the film shows the first sketches of an other world: the world of factory workers with its struggles, strikes and energy. Awards: Cannes Film Festival 1980: Camera D’Or for Debut Feature Film.

Credits: Director, Jean-Pierre Denis ; writers, Francoise Dudognon, Jean-Pierre Denis ; photography, Denis Gheerbrant ; music, Joan Pao Verdier.
Cast: Bertrand Sautereau, Serge Dominique, Pierre Dieuaide, Marcelle Dessales, Odette Peytoureau.

results.title: His worship, Mr Montreal
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James de B. Domville, Donald Brittain, Marrin Canell and Robert Duncan
results.brief_description: A fascinating and spirited portrait of the life and times of the legendary Camillien Houde. Using rare archival footage and recent interviews with ex-colleagues, aides and friends, the film presents a comprehensive profile of this incredible, and, to some, infamous, man.

results.title: His trust; His trust fulfilled
results.brief_description: This melodrama, set during and after the Civil War, is something of a sketch for ‘Birth of a Nation’. Against Griffith’s wishes it was released serially in two parts. In the first part, a faithful black servant, played by a white actor in black face, rescues his master’s child from the burning house. Her father has died fighting for the South. In the second part the old servant after using all his savings, is tempted to steal to pay for the young woman’s education. Cast includes Wilfred Lucas, Claire McDowell, Mack Sennett, Del Henderson, Gladys Egan.

results.title: His Royal Highness
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and F.W. Thring
results.brief_description: George Wallace plays a stage-hand who dreams that he is King. This is Efftee’s third feature and the first all Australian talking musical film. Some lively songs and an ingenious comic performance by George Wallace. Cast also includes Mona Barlee, Marshall Crosby, Lou Vernon.

results.title: His responsibility?
results.brief_description: Ronnie aged 18, learns that his girlfriend is pregnant. Abortion? Illegitimacy? Keeping the baby? Adoption? Marriage? He must decide what his responsibility is. This film helps teenagers preview the consequences of irresponsible actions, as they affect themselves and others.
